channel.title: 377 Client landscape
channel.description: Does anyone know where the 377 client loads the landscape from cache at? I can't find it for the life of me.

item.title: 377 Client landscape
item.dc:creator: @artem543 artem543
item.description:
@artem543 wrote:

It’s in the main class(Client or Game) it should be method22 if I’m not wrong. But it loads map data in the so-called ondemand class

Read full topic

item.title: 377 Client landscape
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:4, topic:539716”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=658557.msg4404989#msg4404989 date=1391652930]
Theres a class where its decoded into a height map, objects, and tile information.
[/quote]Why beat around the bush if you’re going to post? That clearly doesn’t answer his question.[/quote]While I agree with your statement, he without a doubt confirmed that I wasn’t hopelessly looking around for a holy grail.

[quote=“sinisoul, post:5, topic:539716”]Because all clients are rewritten differently and pointing in a general direction is better than giving no direction at all. I dont have an exact class name but I could point to one of my repositories where it is.[/quote]https://github.com/Rabrg/refactored-client/ Although it’s a 317 client I can’t imagine much has changed between the two.

Edit: I have my suspicion this is where I need to look. https://github.com/Rabrg/refactored-client/blob/master/src/com/runescape/Game.java#L10671
Edit 2: nope. not it.
Edit 3: K found it. The map system is a /little/ different from RSC. NOT.

Read full topic
